Detailed Description

Error class.

Used to handle PHP errors.

Error constant values:

  • E_ERROR = 1
  • E_WARNING = 2
  • E_PARSE = 4
  • E_NOTICE = 8
  • E_CORE_ERROR = 16
  • E_CORE_WARNING = 32
  • E_COMPILE_ERROR = 64
  • E_COMPILE_WARNING = 128
  • E_USER_ERROR = 256
  • E_USER_WARNING = 512
  • E_USER_NOTICE = 1024
  • E_ALL = 32767 in PHP 6, 30719 in PHP 5.3.x, 6143 in PHP 5.2.x
  • E_STRICT = 2048
  • E_RECOVERABLE_ERROR = 4096
  • E_DEPRECATED = 8192 since PHP 5.3.0
  • E_USER_DEPRECATED = 16384 since PHP 5.3.0
License:
http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.txt GNU General Public License
Link:
http://code.ramaboo.com/ Boo Framework
Copyright:
2008 David Singer
Author:
David Singer <david@ramaboo.com>
Version:
1.8.1

static Boo_Error::errorHandlerCallback ( $  error,
$  errorString,
$  filename,
$  line,
$  symbols 
) [static]

Error handler callback method.

Parameters:
int $error Error level.
string $errorString Error message.
string $filename Filename that caused the error.
string $line The line number
array $symbols The active symbols table.
Returns:
bool Function always returns FALSE.

static Boo_Error::isCritical ( $  error  )  [static]

Determins if an error is critical.

Errors that are not considered critical:

  • E_NOTICE
  • E_USER_NOTICE
  • E_USER_WARNING
  • E_DEPRECATED
  • E_USER_DEPRECATED
  • E_ALL

Errors that are considered critical:

  • E_ERROR
  • E_WARNING
  • E_PARSE
  • E_CORE_ERROR
  • E_CORE_WARNING
  • E_COMPILE_WARNING
  • E_COMPILE_ERROR
  • E_USER_ERROR
  • E_STRICT
  • E_RECOVERABLE_ERROR
Parameters:
int $error The error code.
Returns:
bool Returns TRUE if error is critical, FALSE othereise.

static Boo_Error::start ( $  errorTypes = false  )  [static]

Automaticly setup error handing to default settings.

Returns:
string Returns the result of set_error_handler().
See also:
http://us.php.net/set_error_handler
Parameters:
int $errorTypes[optional] Can be used to mask the triggering of Boo_Error::errorHandlerCallback().
